comments.body: either use [--allowSyntheticDefaultImports](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped#a-package-uses-export--but-i-prefer-to-use-default-imports-can-i-change-export--to-export-default) in your tsconfig.json or use `import * as VKBeautify from 'vkbeautify';`

I did, but now I'm getting TSLint errors, telling me to 

48:1  export-just-namespace  Instead of `export =`-ing a namespace, use the body of the namespace as the module body.

I've been puzzled by that message, and tried re-reading the TypeScript namespaces page but I still don't think I get it.

Is it suggesting to go

```
export namespace vkbeautify {
    ...
}
```
?
the name space is not really required. modules can just export functions directly.

Ok, thanks.

Somehow I perceive it as _When I import this module, all those functions will be declared globally_. :)

But so no namespace would be preferable then? I mean, preferable over the `export = `?
the only time you need `export = ` is if you are modeling a node module that exports a function. something like yargs for instance.
